main event: A civilian reported seeing a silvery colored object, stationary and circular, in the sky over Dayton, Ohio on April 17, 1958.
interesting points: The object appeared to be the size of the head of a pin., The object was observed for a duration between 0-10 minutes., A weather balloon was released at the time of the sighting, which could explain the observation., The witness had uncertainty regarding the object's identification, suggesting it could be a balloon or an aircraft., No photographs were taken during the observation.
